channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain blocked, 28th January
item.description:
Opposite village hall, drain blocked, water wil be running constantly for 10/12 days once stopped raining, cars constantly spraying water over buildings and dangerous when trying to exit or enter the Stables.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury

item.title: Tree caught on telephone line, 28th January
item.description:
The tree has been caught on the telephone wire for a few days and is pulling the wire down. Both are moving in the wind. The area has been coned off but the tree is likely to fall past the cones onto the other side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Kingsditch, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Dangerous! cars are not stopping on green, 28th January
item.description:
Dangerous. Pavement closed and having to cross on a bend, cars coming around blind bend too quickly to safely cross with children. Ones at the lights. Green man crossing but cars still coming through! It is a matter of time before there is a collision with these roadworks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement is overgrown, 28th January
item.description:
Pavement is overgrown with grass and moss making a dangerous journey to walk into the village. I can see this has already been reported and not addressed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Colesbourne, Cotswold

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Wet leaves on pavement between west down gardens and Eldon road, 28th January
item.description:
Since autumn dead leaves on pavement have not been cleared. Now mashed down to a slippery dangerous mess. Even more dangerous when weather is frosty. Specially bad on stretch between west down gardens and Eldon Road right hand side going away from London Road. Other pavements on Hewlett Road also affected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colesbourne, Cotswold

item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Pedestrian crossing timings DANGEROUS, 28th January
item.description:
A car nearly collided with two children after school when they gave way at roundabout. They would not have seen red light as they had passed and given way but slow traffic meant traffic still passing through when on green. Car was a metre away from hitting a pushchair and walking child. I witnessed again an hour later when green crossing light, at least 5 cars passing through after giving way! Lights too far back for queueing traffic. I'm surprised a serious collision has not occured.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: Road markings very faded, 28th January
item.description:
Entire road between Prestbury and Southam needs the markings re-painted at the very least; ideally with the outside of the road lined also. New cats eyes would be great too if possible but less urgent. The markings are impossible to see in glare, particularly when wet and it's causing vehicles to brake suddenly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Thick mud and leaf debris on the street and pavements. Uneven and rocking paving slabs in the street where hospital patients park for day visits., 28th January
item.description:
We have been waiting for months for the trees to be trimmed and street to be cleaned. Potholes are sorting and pavements are slippery and dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Orrisdale Terrace, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
